content.description:
Crouch start on the good crimp rail feature in the middle of the face. make a few moves and enter a beat down crux. As the good holds abruptly come to an end, a blank wall awaits with only one half pad crimp far away. Make the iron cross move and then piano match to then make a lunge out to the jug.Â 


Middle of the big square face. Sit start possible. sit sit sit start possible. So many possibilities.

Start left of State of the art by 6'. The start holds are located underneath a mini roof. Locate a left hand ledge and a right hand on a sidepull "pocket". Immediately move into the mini roof and cross over to a good right sloping crimp. figure out how to get into state of the art from there and keep moving right.



Start left of State of the art by 6'. The start holds are located underneath a mini roof. Locate a left hand ledge and a right hand on a sidepull "pocket". Immediately move into the mini roof and cross over to a good right sloping crimp. figure out how to get into state of the art from there and keep moving right.

This tall boulder offers so much potential. With an already established V7 called State of the Art, many more can exist with a cool low start into State of the Art as well. The face that is in the corridor holds a vast array of big sloping rails that have the potential to be a 30' climb on amazingly cool holds if you can but find a way to link them together. This side of the boulder has multiple different landing zones thus giving it the chance to be a "safe" 30' climb. Right around the corner, facing downhill, is an intimidating looking 45 degree jet black wall full of small bad holds. This wall has the potential for multiple double digit problems that are safe but tall enough to be "cool". Wheres the strong climbers at?
